name: Dagger
desc:
A standard dagger with a straight blade.
Though modest in reach and capacity for harm, this weapons is light enough to jab in rapid succession and delivers devastating critical hits.

name: Parrying dagger
desc:
A knife with curved handguards. Designed to parry turning foes' attacks against them.

For master of combat who anticipate every enem strike and counter accordingly, this weapons is all they need.

name: Mis√©ricorde
desc:
Dagger favored by military physicians in white. The pointed blade is hard and sharp, making critical hits especially potent.

Medicine is mercy, and mercy upon the battlefield is ruthless. Beware the killers clothes as men of compassion.

name: Great knife
desc:
Large knife with a broad, curved blade.

This weapons is designed to Spinning Slash and rend, inflicting blood loss upon the recipient.

position.info: Drop from Demi-human (4) hidden in a flock of sheep.
Drop from Demi-human (1) hidden in a bush at the start of the dungeon.

name: Bloodstained dagger
desc:
Dagger with a bloodstained blade.
Afflicts targets with blood loss.

As blood darkened the dager through repeated slashing and stabbing, its blade only grew sharper and harder.

position.info: Drop from Chief Demi-human (1) before the wooden bridge.
Drop from Chief Demi-Human (2) sleeping, close to each other

name: Erdsteel dagger
desc:
An erdsteel dagger with a grass crest engraved upon its blade. Carried by the Erdtree royalty for self-defense in times of peace.

Though forged to a high standard, the weapon is difficult to wield.
Attack power also scales with faith

position.info: Given as reward from Kenneth Haight, after clearing out Fort Haight.

name: Wakizashi
desc:
Short sword with a tempering pattern on the blade. A weapon unique to warriors of the Land of Reeds. Afflicts targets with blood loss.

These swords are considered auxiliary weapons. Yet, one man is known to wield this weapons in his left hand while using a full-sized katana in his right. A demonic swordsman known only a Okina.

name: Celebrant's sickle
desc:
Sickle decorated with flowers and many-coloured fabrics. Ceremonial tools used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.

Crafted by human bone.
Grants trace amounts of runes on landing attacks.

name: Ivory sickle
desc:
Sickle fashioned from ivory.
Weapon carried by aged Albinaurics.

These weapons are evidence of their dedication to the Haligtree, despite never having entered its presence.

name: Crystal knife
desc:
A knife made by sharpening hard crystal.
Signature weapon of glintstone miners.

Used as a tool to extract glintstone from broken rock, and as such a faint magic enwreathes the blade.

position.info: Found in a chest inside the Raya Lucaria Crytal Tunnel.

name: Scorpion's stinger
desc:
Dagger fashioned from a great scorpion's tail, glistening with scarlet rot.

A ceremonial toolf used by heretics, crafted from a relic of a sealed outer god.

name: Cinquedea
desc:
Short sword given to high ranking clergymen of Farum Azula.
Raises potency of bestial incantations.

The design celebrates a beast's five fingers, symbolic of the intelligence once granted upon their kind.

name: Glintstone kris
desc:
Ritual blade once presented to Leyndell by the Academy of Raya Lucaria to celebrate their newfound peace.

Though the weapon is embedded with precious glintstones and features Erdtree ornamentation, the undulating blade is sumbolic of an ancient ritual.

name: Reduvia
desc:
Jagged dagger with a distinctive curled balde.
Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood.

This dagger rips the flesh as it enters, inflicting blood loss with sickening efficacy. A proud testament to the success of it wicious design, this weapons is perpetually coated in blood.

name: Blade of calling
desc:
Dagger given to one who set out on a journey to fullfill her duty long ago. The power of its former owner, the kindling maiden, is still apparent.

The one who walks alongside flame, Shall one day meet the road of Destined Death.

name: Black knife
desc:
Dagger once belonging to one of the assassins who murdered Godwyn the Golden on the Night of the Black Knives.

A ritual performed on the oddly misshapen blade imbued it with the power of the stolen Rune of Death.

name: Short sword
desc:
A short straight sword with a short blade.
In addition to its reliable standard damage, this weapon also boasts powerful piercing attacks.

Lightweight amongst straight swords, this weapon is easy to wield, requiring only humble attributes.

name: Longsword
desc:
A straight sword with a double-edged blade.
In addition to its easily-inflicted standard damage, this well-balanced weapon can also perform powerful piercing attacks.

name: Broadsword
desc:
A straight sword with a wide blade, suited to slashing attacks.

Horizontal swings boast wide attack range, making it easier to connect with foes.

name: Weathered straight sword
desc:
Straight sword with a rather short but wide blade.

Simple to wield, it was known as the sword of the people.
Though the Erdtree styling is still visible, time has not been kind to this sword, now merely a shadow of its former self.

name: Lordsworn's straight sword
desc:
Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army.

Though blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a sevicable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.

name: Noble's slender sword
desc:
Narrow blade carried by wandering nobles.
Made to be easy to wield.

Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.

name: Cane sword
desc:
Beloved sword of an aged knight whose last quest was long behind him, repurposed into a walking stick. The tip is rather worn.

Though bent of back and without the brawn required even to raise the sword aloft, still he wished to meet his end with weapon in hand.

name: Warhawk's talon
desc:
Talon-swords are affixed to the legs of the Stormveil's warhawks, but this one has been repurposed for human use.

The blade is thin and lightwaight so as not to obstruct the hawk's mobility.

name: Lazuli glintstone sword
desc:
A sword with a glintstone in its handguards. Wielded by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus who seek to master Carian sorcery. Deals magic damage.

Apparently once used as a staff of sorcery, this sword is made of wood.

name: Carian knight's sword
desc:
Straight sword embedded with a blue glintstone.
Weapon of knights sworn to Carian royalty.

These knights' swords could serve as catalysts, letting them wield sorcerous battle skills. Despite numbering fewer than twenty, this power made them a match for even the champions of gold in battle.

name: Crystal sword
desc: Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard thair crystals unto the end. One theoyr posits that yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.

name: Rotten crystal sword
desc:
Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human, it festers with scarlet rot.

Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence.

name: Miquellan knight's sword
desc:
Sword forged by servants of Miquella of the Haligtree, with a design modeled after those carried by Carian knights. Insted of glintstone however, amber from the Haligtree is embedded in the blade.
A sumptuous piece, yet has never been offered to any knight - an ill-starred sword with no master.

name: Ornamental straight sword
desc:
Slender straight sword patterned after an antiue ornament.
Superior swordsmen prefer to wield one in each hand.

After falling from grace, the dregs of the golden lineage sought power and purpose in the past.

name: Golden epitaph
desc:
A sword made to commemorate the death of Godwyn the Golden, first of the demigods to die.

Infused with the humble prayer of a young boy; "O brother, lord brother, please die a true death."

name: Sword of St. Trina
desc: Silver sword carried by clerics of St. Trina. Inflicts sleep ailment upon foes. St. Trina is an enigmatic figure. Some say she is a comely young girl, others are sure he is a boy. The only cerainty is that their appearance was a sudden as their disappearance.

name: Regalia of Eochaid
desc:
Treasured sword of Eochaid, a lesser, long-vanished domain. The copper coloration is not be confused for rust, but is a conduit for its wieldeer to move it by their will alone.

Swords of Eochaid dance through the skies.

name: Coded sword
desc: Hidden sword once granted to the Tarnished of the Roundtable by the Two Fingers. A formless cipher comprises its blade, which deals holy damage no shield can repel. Campions would gather at the Roundtable Hold in days long past, when the Two Fingers were masters of oration, their flesh yet full of vigor.

name: Sword of night and flame
desc:
Storied sword and treasure of Caria Manor.
One of the legendary armaments.

Astrologers, who preceded the sorcerers, established themselves in mountaintops that nearly touched the sky, and considered the Fire Giants their neighbors.

name: Bastard sword
desc:
A large sword with a straight blade.
This heavy sword is normally wielded with two hands, but thos with sufficient strength can wield it in one alone.
The heft blade can be swung into multiple foes at once thanks to the broad sweeping attacks, making fending off crowds all the easier.

name: Claymore
desc:
A large sword with a long, straight blade. This heavy sword is usually wielded with two hands, but for those with enought strength, one is sufficient.

In addition to the heavy sweeping attacks, it can also make a heavy piercing thrust making this a versatile weapon.

name: Iron greatsword
desc:
Greatsword with a blade of unusually thick steel.
A corse weapon to which polishing is a foreign concept.

Weighty even among other of its class, the impact of each strike is sure to be felt.

name: Lordsworn's greatsword
desc:
Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army.

Through blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a serviceable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.

name: Knight's greatsword
desc:
Greatsword bestowed upon skilled swordsmen in the demigods' service, and yet had no rank or title.

Featuring a long grip enabling a dual-handed use, this weapon was designed to dispatch larger foes. Being charged with such a duty was undoubtedly a great honor.

name: Banished knight's greatsword
desc: A finely-crafted greatsword intricately engraved with an ancient motiv. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

name: Forked greatsword
desc:
Oddly shaped greatsword wielded by imps.

The gently undulating forked blade is known as an "imp's tongue" and causes blood loss.

name: Flamberge
desc:
Greatsword featuring a flame-like undulation.
Shreds enemy flesh, inducing blood loss.

Scarlet rot is kept at bay with flame at Redmane Castle, and as such, this beloved sword of Jerren's eventually became the symbol of the castle itself.

name: Gargoyle's Greatsword
desc:
Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyles.

Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse was; a patchwork of champions.

name: Gargoyle's Blackblade
desc: Bronze greatsword wielded by Valian Gargoyles mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage.1n1nSuch is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade

name: Inseparable Sword
desc:
Sword forged by compounding silver and golf. A sacred weapon to hunt Those Who Live in Death.
Deals holy damage.

The inseparable twins found solace in the Golden Order, the only institution not to revile them as accursed beings.

name: Sword of Milos
desc:
Sinister greatsword fashioned from a giant's backbone.

Mates out wounds like a lopsided saw-blade, and restores some FP upon defeating an enemt.

Milos was undersized for a giant, and was viewed as sullied and terribly grotesque.

name: Marais Executioner's Sword
desc:
Storied sword of House Marais, the family of executioners who presided over the Shaded Castle. One of the legendary armaments.

Elemr of the Briar, the Bell Bearing Hunter, snatched the sword from the site of hise looming execution, and furnished it with battle skills from his home of Eochaid.

name: Ordovis' Greatsword
desc:
Greatsworfd of Ordovis, one of the two honored as foremost among the Crucible Knights.

This sword is imbued with an ancient holy essence.
Its red tint exemplifies the nature of primordial gold, said to be close in nature to life itself.

name: Alabaster Lord's Sword
desc:
Greatsword forged from a blue-white meteoric ore.
The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic.

A weapon unique to the Alabaster Lords, a race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.

name: Death's Poker
desc:
Barbed rod carried by Deathbirds.

The birds are graveyard fire keepers; it is said they rake out the ashen remains of the dead from their kilns.

name: Helphen's Steeple
desc:
Greatsword patterned after black steeple of the Helphen, the lampwood which guides the dead of the spirit world.

The lamplight is similar to grace in appearance, only it is said that can only be seen by those who met their death in battle.

name: Blasphemous Blade
desc:
Sacred sword of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy.
Remains of the countless heroes he has devoured writhe upon the surface of this blade.

Now they share the same blood, bound together as family.
Some HP is restored upon defeating an enemy.

name: Golden Order Greatsword
desc:
Greatsword made of light, modeled after the Elden Ring itself.
Forged by King Consort Radagon to proudly symbolize the tenets of the Golden Order.
One of the legendary armaments.

Telltale signs betray that this was once the greatsword bequeathed to him by his first wife, Rennala.

name: Dark Moon Greatsword
desc:
A Moon Greatsword, bestowed by a Carian queen upon her spouse to honor long-standing tradition.
One of the legendary armaments.

Ranni's sigil is a full moon, cold and leaden, and this sord is but a beam of its light.

name: Sacred Relic Sword
desc:
Sword wrought from the remains of a god who should have lived a life eternal.

Thoughts on what the weapon portend are many and varied. Some consider it the mark of a great sin, or a sign of great devastation. Some think of it as the end of an age, while others, the beginning.

name: Zweihander
desc:
Just about the largest sword a mere man is capable of swinging. True to its name, it is designed to be wielded in both hands, but those of merely ordinary strength will still struggle to do so.

The long blade is heavy and sharp, sending foes reeling back with its broader strokes, while also capable of devastating percing thrust.

name: Greatsword
desc:
A coarse iron lump of an ultra greatsword.
Mows down foes by utilizing its incredible weight.

Though handling it likely requires the wielder to have surpassed the realm of the merely human, it is precisely for this reason the weapon is use to slaughter even inhuman foes.

name: Watchdog's Greatsword
desc:
Stone greatsword wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs.

Though decorated with the watchman's eye, the pupil was taken by graverobbers and is now hollow, leaving this sword a mere lump of stone.

name: Troll's Golden Sword
desc:
Sword given to the lesser giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago.

Though the giants have lost their minds, they stay insseparable from their swords that are in sad shape - such that the gold plating had flakes away.

name: Troll Knight's Sword
desc:
Greatsword embedded with a blue glintstone.
Weapon of the trolls in service to the royal family of Caria.

Called into service when the Queen invoked an oath they swore, the trolls are treated as true knights of Caria, and fight arm in arm with their human comrades.

name: Royal Greatsword
desc:
Greatsword decorated in royal Carian Style. Favored weapon of Blaidd the Half-Wolf.

In defiance of the fate he was born to, Blaidd swore to serve no master but Ranni. As proof, the sword was imbued with a cold magic at the moment oath was sworn.

name: Grafted Blade Greatsword
desc:
The storie dsword of Castle Morne. A revenger's weapon, it is burdened with oceans of anger and regret.
One of the legendary armaments.

A lone surviving champion from a country now vanished was so determined to continue fighting that he claimed the swords of an entire clan of warriors.

name: Starscourge Greatsword
desc:
Curved greatsword of black steel wielded by General Radahn. A pair of weapons decorated with a lion mane motif.

Radahn earned considerable renown as the Starscourge in his youth, and it is said that it was during this time he engraved the gravity crest upon these blades.

name: Ruins Greatsword
desc:
Originally rubble from a ruin which fell from the sky, this surviving fragment was honed into a weapon.
One of the legendary armaments.

The ruin it came from crumbled when struck by a meteorite, as such this weapon harbors its destructive power.

name: Godslayer's Greatsword
desc:
Sacred sword of the Gloam-Eyed Queen who controlled the Godskin Apostles before her defeat at the hands of Maliketh.

The black flames wielded by the apostles are channeled from this sword.

name: Maliketh's Black Blade
desc:
Maliketh's black blade which once harbored the power of the Rune of Death. A sad shadow of its former glory.

After a fragment of Death was stolen on that fateful night, Maliketh bound the blade within his own flesh, such that none might ever rob Death again.

name: Rapier
desc:
A piercing sword with a sharp, slender blade.
In addition to this weapon's thrusting attack prowess, it also boasts the ability to be used while guarding with a shield.

As one of the smaller piercing sword, quick successive thrust area easy to perform, but without a cutting edge, it cannot be used for slashing attacks.

name: Estoc
desc:
Large piercing sword with a long, hard bladed edge which is also capable of slashing attacks.

For its large size, it can be wielded rather nimbly, leaving little opportunity for the enemy to counter.

name: Noble's Estoc
desc:
Estoc carried by wandering nobles. Made to be easy to wield.

Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.

name: Cleanrot Knight's Sword
desc:
Piercing sword of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

MAinly used as a backup weapon, in combination with a long-handled armament.

name: Rogier's Rapier
desc:
Piercing sword of superior quality, featuring intricate ornamentation.
Signature weapon of the sorcerer Rogier.

High dexterity is required to wield the blade to its full potential, but mastery is a sight to behold, characterized by a flowing style which excels in successive attacks.

name: Antspur Rapier
desc:
Spur of a giant ant which has been fashioned into a rapier. The blade drips with scarlet rot.

Scarlet rot is an old legend, of which Maleigh Marais of the Shaded Castle was a private believer. And indeed, he eventually found his own personal goddess.

name: Frozen Needle
desc:
A razor-thin piercing blade of ice.
Forged by Ijii, the carian Royal Blackmith.

Can inflict frost upon enemies, and launch its blade with a strong attack. The blade immediately regenerates.

name: Godskin Stitcher
desc:
Elegant piercing sword with a celadon colored blade wielded by Godskin Nobles.

The nobles possess skill with the sword unmatched by any lowborn. Despite its size, successive attacks from this weapon are swifter than the eye can follow.

name: Bloody Helice
desc:
Ominous piercing sword with a winding blade. Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood.

Designed to bore into flesh, causing severe blood loss at the wound. The extracted blood trickles gracefully down the length of the blade.

name: Dragon King's Cragblade
desc:
Piercing Gravel Stone sword containing primeval lightning.
A portion of the Dragonlord's power, gained from a remembrance.

This weapon commands great power over the paltry, mortal dragons of today.

name: Scimitar
desc:
A curved sword with a single-sided blade.
Delivers slashing attacks with its sharp blade, but is ineffective against armor and hides covered in tough scales.
Smaller in size than most curved swords, it carves into enemies with quick, sharp cuts.

name: Falchio
desc:
A curved sword with a single-sided blade.
Delivers slashing attacks with its sharp blade, but is ineffective against thick armor and hides covered in tough scales.

Wielders of the weapon employ a unique style that enchances attacks with spinning motions..

name: Shamshir
desc:
Curved sword with a thin blade of ample length. Light of weight despite its larger size, its slicing attacks come in rapid succession.

A devastatingly powerful weapon in the hands of a skilled swordsman.

name: Grossmesser
desc:
Curved sword boasting a large blade.
This weapon is designed to make use of its weight in combination with its sharp cutting edge.

A thorougly reliable choice of weapon for those who can master its particulars.

name: Bandit's Curved Sword
desc:
Curved sword with a light, crescent-shaped blade.
Used by the bandits who ran rampant in the wake of the Shattering.

Most of the blade is now darkened and covered in rust, but with enough dexterity this weapon may still stand up to some use.

name: Shotel
desc:
Curved sword with a severely hooked blade. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.

Made to hunt down humans, this weapon requires high dexterity to wield efficiently.

name: Scavenger's Curved Sword
desc:
Unique curved sword, notched like shark's teeth.
Weapon carried by corpse pillagers who prowl the sites of old battles.

The blade is tacky with blood and covered in hefty nicks making it totally uneven. Life can be sinister indeed.

name: Mantis Blade
desc:
A curved sword with a blade at both ends wielded by the Cemetery Shades, the insect-ridden grave keepers.

The blade is thin and sharp, and strong attack unleashes a far-reaching slash.

name: Beastman's Curved Sword
desc:
Curved sword forged of dull iron wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula.

The blade is heavy but well-balanced. Comparatively easy to wield for the damage it delivers.

name: Flowing Curved Sword
desc:
Legends speak of a master of the sword garbed in blue, and his curved blade that was patterned after flowing water.
Strong attack unleashes a series of strikes akin to a dance, offering a glimpse into the legend.

name: Serpent-God's Curved Sword
desc:
Curved sword faschioned in the image of an ancient serpent deity and tool of a forgotten religion practiced on Mt. Gelmir.

Formerly ised to offer up sacrifices, this sword restores HP upon slaying an enemy.

name: Magma Blade
desc:
Curved sword with a blade fashioned from the lava of Mt. Gelmir.
An armament of the man-serpents, impossible for a human to have made.

Deals fire damage.

name: Nox Flowing Sword
desc:
A grim weapon wielded by swordsman of the Eternal City, this shotel has a blade as fine as a needle.

Forged from the liquid metal of a Silver Tear, it is throughly tempered until hardened.

name: Wing of Astel
desc:
CuSword faschioned form a delicate wing, suffused with the magic of the stars.
Strong attack unleashes a wave of enchanted light.

Crafted from a relic of the Naturalborn of the Void who is said to have assailed the Eternal City.

name: Dismounter
desc:
This curved greatsword wielded by the brawny sellswords of Kaiden combines the blades of a schimitar with the heft of a hatchet.

A difficult to handle weapon that demands much of the wielder's strength and dexterity, but with practice and ability, it can serve as a versatile weapon even on horseback.

name: Dismounter
desc:
Heavy.bladed curved sword of colossal size awarded to Omen as a tool of war. This weapon is made to take advantage of brute strength.

The pattern etched upon the blade is the remnant of a deteriorating malediction. Indeed, when bestowing a weapon, preparations must be made for taking it away.

name: Monk's Flameblade
desc:
Curved sword with a flickering flame motif.
Wielded by the Fire Monks who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants.

The monks came to the land of Liurnia in pursuit of a fugitive who stole their fire.

name: Beastman's Cleaver
desc:
Curved greatsword of colossal size forged of dull iron and wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula.

The blade is incredibly heavy, but well-balanced. Comparatively easy to wield for the damage it delivers. It's clear the beastmen possess knowledge beyond human ken.

name: Bloodhound's Fang
desc:
Curved greatsword with a gently undulating blade wielded by Bloodhound Knights.

A fearsome blade capable of brutal airborne attacks.

name: Onix Lord's Greatsword
desc:
Greatsword forged from golden-hued meteoric ore.
The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic.

A weapon unique to the Onyx Lords, a race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.

name: Zamor Curved Sword
desc:
Weapoon wielded by the knights of Zamor who earned great renown during the War against the Giants.

In apparent devotion to winter, the curved blade is stled after an icy wind and imbued with a powerful frost effect.

name: Magma Wyrm's Scalesword
desc:
Curved greatsword wielded by Magma Wyrms. The shape resembles a dragon's jaw and is covered in hard scales.

It's said these land-bound dragons were once humans heroes who partook in dragon communion, a grave trasgression for which they were cursed to crawl the earth upon their bellies, shadows of their former selves.

name: Morgott's Cursed Sword
desc:
Warped blade of shifting hue used by Morgott, the Omen King.

The accused blood that Morgott recanted and sealed away reformed into this blade.
